me.wobblyyyy.pathfinder2.geometry

Class Rectangle

  • java.lang.Object
    • me.wobblyyyy.pathfinder2.geometry.Rectangle
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, Shape<Rectangle>

    public class Rectangle
extends java.lang.Object
implements Shape<Rectangle>
    A rectangle! It has four vertices and four lines. There's not much more to say, to be honest, but they're pretty cool.

    Rectangles can be rotated! Check out the following methods:

    • newRotatedRectangle(double, double, double, double, Angle)
    • rotate(Angle)
    • rotate(Angle, PointXY)

    Since:
    0.1.0
    Author:
    Colin Robertson
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • Rectangle

        public Rectangle(PointXY a,
                 PointXY b,
                 PointXY c,
                 PointXY d)
        Create a new rectangle based on four points.

        It's suggested that you use the other constructor, Rectangle(double, double, double, double), instead of this constructor, unless you have a specific reason to use this constructor instead.

        Rectangles must be constructed as follows. As a visual example: 

           B                   C
   #####################
   #                   #
   #                   #
   #                   #
   #####################
   A                   D
        As a text-based example, the following points should be adjacent.
        • A should be adjacent to B and D.
        • B should be adjacent to A and C.
        • C should be adjacent to B and D.
        • D should be adjacent to C and A.

        The following lines MUST be parallel - if they're not, you'll get an IllegalArgumentException.

        • AB should be parallel to CD.
        • BC should be parallel to AD.

        Parameters:
        a - one of the rectangle's four points. Should be adjacent to B and D.
        b - one of the rectangle's four points. Should be adjacent to A and C.
        c - one of the rectangle's four points. Should be adjacent to B and D.
        d - one of the rectangle's four points. Should be adjacent to C and A.

      • Rectangle

        public Rectangle(double minX,
                 double minY,
                 double maxX,
                 double maxY)
        Create a new rectangle by giving minimum and maximum values.

        maxX - the maximum X value.
        maxY - the maximum Y value.

        Description copied from interface: Shape
        Resize the shape.
        Specified by:
        scale in interface Shape<Rectangle>
        Parameters:
        scale - the new scale for the shape. If this number is 2, the shape will double in size. If this number is 0.5, the shape will be half the original size.
        Returns:
        the scaled shape.
